title: Detectability Thresholds for Network Attacks on Static Graphs and Temporal Networks: Information-Theoretic Limits and Nearly-Optimal Tests
summary: This paper develops a consolidated theory for the detectability of network-borne attacks under two observation models: static graphs and temporal interaction networks modeled by multivariate point processes (Poisson or Hawkes). The main contribution is to match information-theoretic lower and upper bounds that govern when reliable testing is possible.
